alert.note: Alert for Banner; Cheyenne; Kimball; Morrill (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 4:04AM CDT until June 17 at 4:30AM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM MDT FOR WEST CENTRAL CHEYENNE...NORTHEASTERN KIMBALL...SOUTHWESTERN MORRILL AND SOUTHERN BANNER COUNTIES... At 303 AM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles east of La Grange to near Harrisburg to 11 miles northwest of Potter to 7 miles south of Dix, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Kimball, Potter, Dix and Harrisburg. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 22 and 42. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
